technologies.name: WordPress
technologies.description: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database. Features include a plugin architecture and a template system.

technologies.name: MySQL
technologies.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

technologies.name: PHP
technologies.description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language used for web development.

technologies.name: Facebook Login
technologies.description: Facebook Login is a way for people to create accounts and log into your app across multiple platforms.

technologies.name: Bootstrap
technologies.description: Bootstrap is a free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development. It contains CSS and JavaScript-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation, and other interface components.

technologies.name: The Events Calendar
technologies.description: The Events Calendar is a free event management plugin for WordPress.

technologies.name: Contact Form 7
technologies.description: Contact Form 7 is an WordPress plugin which can manage multiple contact forms. The form supports Ajax-powered submitting, CAPTCHA, Akismet spam filtering.

technologies.name: Yoast SEO
technologies.description: Yoast SEO is a search engine optimisation plugin for WordPress and other platforms.

technologies.name: Cloudways
technologies.description: Cloudways offers managed cloud-hosting services for WordPress sites on a cloud server where multiple copies of your content will be replicated throughout your chosen data center.

technologies.name: WPML
technologies.description: WPML plugin makes it possible to build and run fully multilingual WordPress sites.

technologies.name: Site Kit
technologies.description: Site Kit is a one-stop solution for WordPress users to use everything Google has to offer to make them successful on the web.

technologies.name: LazySizes
technologies.description: LazySizes is a JavaScript library used to delay the loading of images (iframes, scripts, etc) until they come into view.

technologies.name: jQuery Migrate
technologies.description: Query Migrate is a javascript library that allows you to preserve the compatibility of your jQuery code developed for versions of jQuery older than 1.9.

technologies.name: jQuery
technologies.description: jQuery is a JavaScript library which is a free, open-source software designed to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation, as well as event handling, CSS animation, and Ajax.

technologies.name: Google Analytics
technologies.description: Google Analytics is a free web analytics service that tracks and reports website traffic.

technologies.name: Priority Hints
technologies.description: Priority Hints exposes a mechanism for developers to signal a relative priority for browsers to consider when fetching resources.

technologies.name: HSTS
technologies.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS.

technologies.name: Sendinblue
technologies.description: Sendinblue is an email marketing solution for small and medium-sized businesses that want to send and automate email marketing campaigns.

technologies.name: OVHcloud
technologies.description: OVHcloud is a global, cloud provider delivering hosted private cloud, public cloud, and dedicated server solutions.

technologies.name: RSS
technologies.description: RSS is a family of web feed formats used to publish frequently updated works—such as blog entries, news headlines, audio, and video—in a standardized format.

technologies.name: PWA
technologies.description: Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) are web apps built and enhanced with modern APIs to deliver enhanced capabilities, reliability, and installability while reaching anyone, anywhere, on any device, all with a single codebase.

technologies.name: Open Graph
technologies.description: Open Graph is a protocol that is used to integrate any web page into the social graph.
